meanings.definition: To cause someone to adopt radical positions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The group tried to radicalize new members by promoting extreme ideas.
meanings.sent2: The activist hoped to radicalize others to join the protest.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character tried to radicalize the other characters into wearing silly hats.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the cause radicalized her approach to activism.
meanings.sent5: The intense documentary about climate change really radicalized my views on environmental issues.

meanings.definition: To become radical in beliefs or actions.
meanings.sent1: Over time, he began to radicalize and advocate for drastic changes.
meanings.sent2: She started to radicalize after attending a series of political rallies.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to radicalize its behavior by demanding breakfast at 4 am.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job and travel the world truly radicalized his lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling novel about revolution inspired her to radicalize her approach to social issues.
